title: Regency Era Vocabulary
description: Step into the world of Jane Austen with the language of the British Regency period (1811-1820)

questions.question: In Regency England, what did 'a cut' mean in social terms?
options: A deliberate refusal to acknowledge someone socially

questions.question: What was a 'curricle' in the Regency era?
options: A light two-wheeled carriage drawn by a pair of horses

questions.question: In Regency parlance, what was a 'bluestocking'?
What did 'to take a turn about the room' mean in Regency society?
options: To walk around the room, often for display or conversation
To take a turn at a game

questions.question: In Regency slang, what was a 'dandy'?
options: A man excessively devoted to elegant fashion and style

questions.question: What was 'Almack's' in Regency-era London?
options: An exclusive assembly room where high society danced and socialized

questions.question: In Regency vocabulary, what did 'sensibility' typically refer to?
What was a 'reticule' in the Regency period?
options: A small handbag or purse carried by women

questions.question: In Regency England, what did it mean for a man to 'pay his addresses' to a woman?
options: To court or woo her with marriage intentions

questions.question: What was a 'pelisse' in Regency fashion?
options: A long outer cloak or coat worn by women

questions.question: In Regency slang, what did 'bang up to the mark' mean?
What was a 'living' in Regency-era England?
options: A church position with income, given to a clergyman

questions.question: In Regency vocabulary, what was 'pin money'?
options: A wife's personal allowance for small expenses

questions.question: What was a 'barouche' in the Regency era?
options: A four-wheeled horse-drawn carriage with a collapsible hood

questions.question: In Regency-era usage, what did 'importunate' mean?
options: Persistent to the point of annoyance in making requests
